verses.verse: The children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> traveled,<WH5265> and encamped<WH2583> in the plains<WH6160> of Moab<WH4124> beyond<WH5676> the Jordan<WH3383> at Jericho.<WH3405>
Balak<WH1111> the son<WH1121> of Zippor<WH6834> saw<WH7200> all that Israel<WH3478> had done<WH6213> to the Amorites.<WH567>

Moab<WH4124> was very<WH3966> afraid<WH1481> of<WH6440> the people,<WH5971> because they were many:<WH7227> and Moab<WH4124> was distressed<WH6973> because of<WH6440> the children<WH1121> of Israel.<WH3478>

Moab<WH4124> said<WH559> to the elders<WH2205> of Midian,<WH4080> "Now this multitude<WH6951> will lick up<WH3897> all that is around<WH5439> us,<WH7794> as the ox licks up<WH3897> the grass<WH3418> of the field.<WH7704>" Balak<WH1111> the son<WH1121> of Zippor<WH6834> was king<WH4428> of Moab<WH4124> at that time.<WH6256>

He sent<WH7971> messengers<WH4397> to Balaam<WH1109> the son<WH1121> of Beor,<WH1160> to Pethor,<WH6604> which is by the River,<WH5104> to the land<WH776> of the children<WH1121> of his people,<WH5971> to call<WH7121> him,<WH559> saying, "Behold,<WH5971> there is a people who came out<WH3318> from Egypt.<WH4714> Behold,<WH3680> they cover the surface<WH5869> of the earth,<WH776> and they are staying<WH3427> opposite me.<WH4136>

Please come<WH3212> now therefore curse<WH779> me this people;<WH5971> for they are too mighty<WH6099> for me:<WH3201> perhaps I shall prevail, that we may strike<WH5221> them,<WH1644> and that I may drive them out of the land;<WH776> for I know<WH3045> that he whom you bless<WH1288> is blessed,<WH1288> and he whom you curse<WH779> is cursed.<WH779>"

The elders<WH2205> of Moab<WH4124> and the elders<WH2205> of Midian<WH4080> departed<WH3212> with the rewards of divination<WH7081> in their hand;<WH3027> and they came<WH935> to Balaam,<WH1109> and spoke<WH1696> to him the words<WH1697> of Balak.<WH1111>

He said<WH559> to them,<WH3885> "Lodge here this night,<WH3915> and I will bring<WH7725> you word<WH1697> again,<WH7725> as Yahweh<WH3068> shall speak<WH1696> to me.<WH8269>" The princes of Moab<WH4124> stayed<WH3427> with Balaam.<WH1109>
God<WH430> came<WH935> to Balaam,<WH1109> and said,<WH559> "Who are these men with you?<WH582>"
Balaam<WH1109> said<WH559> to God,<WH430> "Balak<WH1111> the son<WH1121> of Zippor,<WH6834> king<WH4428> of Moab,<WH4124> has said to me,<WH7971>

<WH5971> 'Behold, the people that has come out<WH3318> of Egypt,<WH4714> it covers<WH3680> the surface<WH5869> of the earth:<WH776> now,<WH3212> come curse<WH6895> me them;<WH3201> perhaps I shall be able to fight against<WH3898> them,<WH1644> and shall drive them out.'"
God<WH430> said<WH559> to Balaam,<WH1109> "You shall not go<WH3212> with them.<WH779> You shall not curse the people;<WH5971> for they are blessed.<WH1288>"

Balaam<WH1109> rose up<WH6965> in the morning,<WH1242> and said<WH559> to the princes<WH8269> of Balak,<WH1111> "Go<WH3212> to your land;<WH776> for Yahweh<WH3068> refuses<WH3985> to permit<WH5414> me to go with you.<WH1980>"
The princes<WH8269> of Moab<WH4124> rose up,<WH6965> and they went<WH935> to Balak,<WH1111> and said,<WH559> "Balaam<WH1109> refuses<WH3985> to come with us.<WH1980>"
Balak<WH1111> sent<WH7971> yet again<WH3254> princes,<WH8269> more,<WH7227> and more honorable than they.<WH3513>
They came<WH935> to Balaam,<WH1109> and said<WH559> to him,<WH559> "Thus says Balak<WH1111> the son<WH1121> of Zippor,<WH6834> <WH4513> 'Please let nothing hinder you from coming to me:<WH1980>

for I will promote<WH3513> you to very<WH3966> great<WH3513> honor,<WH3513> and whatever you say<WH559> to me I will do.<WH6213> Please come<WH3212> therefore,<WH6895> and curse this people for me.<WH5971>'"

Balaam<WH1109> answered<WH6030> the servants<WH5650> of Balak,<WH1111> "If Balak<WH1111> would give<WH5414> me his house<WH1004> full<WH4393> of silver<WH3701> and gold,<WH2091> I can't<WH3201> go beyond<WH5674> the word<WH6310> of Yahweh<WH3068> my God,<WH430> to do<WH6213> less<WH6996> or more.<WH1419>
Now therefore,<WH3427> please wait also here this night,<WH3915> that I may know<WH3045> what Yahweh<WH3068> will speak<WH1696> to me more.<WH3254>"

God<WH430> came<WH935> to Balaam<WH1109> at night,<WH3915> and said<WH559> to him,<WH582> "If the men have come<WH935> to call<WH7121> you,<WH6965> rise up, go<WH3212> with them;<WH389> but only the word<WH1697> which I speak<WH1696> to you,<WH6213> that you shall do."
Balaam<WH1109> rose up<WH6965> in the morning,<WH1242> and saddled<WH2280> his donkey,<WH860> and went<WH3212> with the princes<WH8269> of Moab.<WH4124>

God<WH430>'s anger<WH639> was kindled<WH2734> because he went;<WH1980> and the angel<WH4397> of Yahweh<WH3068> placed<WH3320> himself in the way<WH1870> for an adversary<WH7854> against him.<WH7392> Now he was riding on his donkey,<WH860> and his two<WH8147> servants were with him.<WH5288>

The donkey<WH860> saw<WH7200> the angel<WH4397> of Yahweh<WH3068> standing<WH5324> in the way,<WH1870> with his sword<WH2719> drawn<WH8025> in his hand;<WH3027> and the donkey<WH860> turned aside<WH5186> out of the way,<WH1870> and went<WH3212> into the field:<WH7704> and Balaam<WH1109> struck<WH5221> the donkey,<WH860> to turn<WH5186> her into the way.<WH1870>
Then the angel<WH4397> of Yahweh<WH3068> stood<WH5975> in a narrow path<WH4934> between the vineyards,<WH3754> a wall<WH1447> being on this side,<WH1447> and a wall on that side.

The donkey<WH860> saw<WH7200> the angel<WH4397> of Yahweh,<WH3068> and she thrust<WH3905> herself to the wall,<WH7023> and crushed<WH3905> Balaam<WH1109>'s foot<WH7272> against the wall:<WH7023> and he struck<WH5221> her again.<WH3254>

The angel<WH4397> of Yahweh<WH3068> went<WH5674> further,<WH3254> and stood<WH5975> in a narrow<WH6862> place,<WH4725> where there was no way<WH1870> to turn<WH5186> either to the right hand<WH3225> or to the left.<WH8040>

The donkey<WH860> saw<WH7200> the angel<WH4397> of Yahweh,<WH3068> and she lay down<WH7257> under Balaam:<WH1109> and Balaam<WH1109>'s anger<WH639> was kindled,<WH2734> and he struck<WH5221> the donkey<WH860> with his staff.<WH4731>

Yahweh<WH3068> opened<WH6605> the mouth<WH6310> of the donkey,<WH860> and she said<WH559> to Balaam,<WH1109> "What have I done<WH6213> to you,<WH5221> that you have struck me these three<WH7969> times?<WH7272>"
Balaam<WH1109> said<WH559> to the donkey,<WH860> "Because you have mocked<WH5953> me,<WH3863> I wish there were<WH3426> a sword<WH2719> in my hand,<WH3027> for now I would have killed you.<WH2026>"

The donkey<WH860> said<WH559> to Balaam,<WH1109> "Am I not your donkey,<WH860> on which you have ridden<WH7392> all your life long to this day?<WH3117> Was I ever<WH5532> in the habit<WH5532> of doing so<WH6213> to you?<WH559>" He said, "No."

Then Yahweh<WH3068> opened<WH1540> the eyes<WH5869> of Balaam,<WH1109> and he saw<WH7200> the angel<WH4397> of Yahweh<WH3068> standing<WH5324> in the way,<WH1870> with his sword<WH2719> drawn<WH8025> in his hand;<WH3027> and he bowed<WH6915> his head,<WH7812> and fell on his face.<WH639>

The angel<WH4397> of Yahweh<WH3068> said<WH559> to him,<WH5221> "Why have you struck your donkey<WH860> these three<WH7969> times?<WH7272> Behold,<WH3318> I have come forth as an adversary,<WH7854> because your way<WH1870> is perverse before me:<WH3399>

and the donkey<WH860> saw<WH7200> me,<WH5186> and turned aside before me<WH6440> these three<WH7969> times.<WH7272> Unless<WH194> she had turned<WH5186> aside from me,<WH6440> surely now I would have killed<WH2026> you,<WH2421> and saved her alive."

Balaam<WH1109> said<WH559> to the angel<WH4397> of Yahweh,<WH3068> "I have sinned;<WH2398> for I didn't<WH3045> know that you stood<WH5324> in the way<WH1870> against<WH7125> me.<WH7489> Now therefore, if it displeases you, I will go back again.<WH7725>"

The angel<WH4397> of Yahweh<WH3068> said<WH559> to Balaam,<WH1109> "Go<WH3212> with the men;<WH582> but only<WH657> the word<WH1697> that I shall speak<WH1696> to you,<WH1696> that you shall speak." So Balaam<WH1109> went<WH3212> with the princes<WH8269> of Balak.<WH1111>

When Balak<WH1111> heard<WH8085> that Balaam<WH1109> had come,<WH935> he went out<WH3318> to meet<WH7125> him to the City<WH5892> of Moab,<WH4124> which is on the border<WH1366> of the Arnon,<WH769> which is in the utmost<WH7097> part of the border.<WH1366>

Balak<WH1111> said<WH559> to Balaam,<WH1109> "Didn't<WH7971> I earnestly send<WH7971> to you to call<WH7121> you?<WH1980> Why didn't you come to me?<WH3201> Am I not able indeed<WH552> to promote you to honor?<WH3513>"

Balaam<WH1109> said<WH559> to Balak,<WH1111> "Behold,<WH935> I have come to you:<WH3201> have I now any power at all<WH3201> to speak<WH1696> anything?<WH3972> The word<WH1697> that God<WH430> puts<WH7760> in my mouth,<WH6310> that shall I speak.<WH1696>"
Balaam<WH1109> went<WH3212> with Balak,<WH1111> and they came<WH935> to Kiriath Huzoth.<WH2351>
Balak<WH1111> sacrificed<WH2076> cattle<WH1241> and sheep,<WH6629> and sent<WH7971> to Balaam,<WH1109> and to the princes who were with him.<WH8269>

It happened in the morning,<WH1242> that Balak<WH1111> took<WH3947> Balaam,<WH1109> and brought him up<WH5927> into the high places<WH1116> of Baal;<WH1120> and he saw<WH7200> from there the utmost<WH7097> part of the people.<WH5971>
